DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate safety effectiveness minimally invasive surgical procedure 160 implanted female patient two adjustable balloon ( one side urethra ) implant treat urinary stress incontinence . The result analyze demonstrate effect device well associated risk . Therapeutic success base whether patient demonstrate least one-grade ( mean ) reduction Stamey score 12 month .
DOC.brief_title: Adjustable Continence Therapy ( ACT ) Device Treatment Female Stress Urinary Incontinence
DOC.detailed_description: This multi-center , prospective , non randomize clinical trial compare baseline data 12 month data . Urodynamic testing , pad weight direct visual stress test use determine success along Stamey score .
DOC.criteria: Women 18 year old Diagnosed stress urinary incontinence without urethral hypermobility Willing sign inform consent Candidates surgical intervention stress incontinence Negative urinalysis urine culture within 2 week implantation Normal cystourethroscopy Failed least 6 month previous treatment stress urinary incontinence ( e.g. , exercise regimen , electrical stimulation , surgical procedure , etc . ) May fail suspension sling procedure Pregnant lactate Life expectancy less one year Insulin dependant diabetic Autoimmune disease Undergoing radiation therapy Active urinary tract infection Detrusor instability refractory med Reduced bladder compliance Significant bladder residual > 100mls Bladder cancer Unsuccessfully treat bladder stone Current urethral stricture prevent passage 24 FR endoscope Neurogenic bladder Uncorrected rectocele , cystocele , urethrocele , enterocele pelvic prolapse Grade 3 high Prior pelvic radiotherapy Artificial urinary sphincter implant
